p: In addition to increased alcohol abuse/dependence in healthcare workers, it might also be important to screen for depressive symptoms [ 19]. Following the SARS CoV-1 outbreak having been quarantined and pre-SARS trauma exposure were predictors of high levels of depressive symptoms three years after the outbreak [ 19]. While specific groups of healthcare workers may be affected differently during this pandemic, this highlights the long-term effects the COVID-19 pandemic is likely to have on healthcare workers.
